Embedding fonts in CSS using base64 encoding

This is an example of using base64 encoded fonts. You can embed the font directly in your css code.

@font-face { font-family: 'rubik';
  src: url(data:application/x-font-woff;
  charset=utf-8;base64,d09GRgABAAAAAHF8ABIAAAAA...)
  format('woff');
  font-weight: normal;
  font-style: normal;
}

Here I have embedded Rubik font using the tool at: font-converter.net

This paragraph uses Rubik.
